TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit MediaRoute2ProviderService extends Android.App.Service

Docs.summary: Base class for media route provider services.

remarks.para: Base class for media route provider services.

Media route provider services are used to publish MediaRoute2Info media routes such as speakers, TVs, etc. The routes are published by calling #notifyRoutes(Collection). Media apps which use MediaRouter2 can request to play their media on the routes.

When MediaRouter2 media router wants to play media on a route, #onCreateSession(long, String, String, Bundle) will be called to handle the request. A session can be considered as a group of currently selected routes for each connection. Create and manage the sessions by yourself, and notify the RoutingSessionInfo session infos when there are any changes.

The system media router service will bind to media route provider services when a RouteDiscoveryPreference discovery preference is registered via a MediaRouter2 media router by an application. See #onDiscoveryPreferenceChanged(RouteDiscoveryPreference) for the details.
Use #notifyRequestFailed(long, int) to notify the failure with previously received request ID.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void OnCreateSession (long requestId, string packageName, string routeId, Android.OS.Bundle? sessionHints);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnCreateSession(int64 requestId, string packageName, string routeId, class Android.OS.Bundle sessionHints) cil managed
abstract member OnCreateSession : int64 * string * string * Android.OS.Bundle -> unit

Docs.param: the package name of the application that selected the route
the ID of the route initially being connected
an optional bundle of app-specific arguments sent by MediaRouter2, or null if none. The contents of this bundle may affect the result of session creation.
Docs.summary: Called when the service receives a request to create a session.

remarks.para: Called when the service receives a request to create a session.

You should create and maintain your own session and notifies the client of session info. Call #notifySessionCreated(long, RoutingSessionInfo) with the given requestId to notify the information of a new session. The created session must have the same route feature and must include the given route specified by routeId.
If the session can be controlled, you can optionally pass the control hints to RoutingSessionInfo.Builder#setControlHints(Bundle). Control hints is a Bundle which contains how to control the session.
If you can't create the session or want to reject the request, call #notifyRequestFailed(long, int) with the given requestId.

format.a: Java documentation for android.media.MediaRoute2ProviderService.onCreateSession(long, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, android.os.Bundle).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnDiscoveryPreferenceChanged(class Android.Media.RouteDiscoveryPreference preference) cil managed
abstract member OnDiscoveryPreferenceChanged : Android.Media.RouteDiscoveryPreference -> unit override this.OnDiscoveryPreferenceChanged : Android.Media.RouteDiscoveryPreference -> unit

Docs.summary: Called when the RouteDiscoveryPreference discovery preference has changed.

remarks.para: Called when the RouteDiscoveryPreference discovery preference has changed.

Whenever an application registers a MediaRouter2.RouteCallback callback, it also provides a discovery preference to specify features of routes that it is interested in. The media router combines all of these discovery request into a single discovery preference and notifies each provider.

The provider should examine RouteDiscoveryPreference#getPreferredFeatures() preferred features in the discovery preference to determine what kind of routes it should try to discover and whether it should perform active or passive scans. In many cases, the provider may be able to save power by not performing any scans when the request doesn't have any matching route features.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void OnReleaseSession (long requestId, string sessionId);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnReleaseSession(int64 requestId, string sessionId) cil managed
abstract member OnReleaseSession : int64 * string -> unit

Docs.param: the ID of the session being released.
Docs.summary: Called when the session should be released.

remarks.para: Called when the session should be released. A client of the session or system can request a session to be released.
After releasing the session, call #notifySessionReleased(String) with the ID of the released session. Note: Calling #notifySessionReleased(String) will NOT trigger this method to be called.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
